<<<api>>>: Random.nextInt()
<<<code>>>: for(Iterator<DataSnapshot> it = dataSnapshot.getChildren().iterator(); it.hasNext(); ){
int randomValue = Random.nextInt(100);
if(randomValue <= 20){
names.add(it.next().getValue(String.class));
}
}
<<<explanation>>>: You can use the Random.nextInt() method to generate a random integer within a range. In your case, you want to generate a random integer between 1 and 100 and make sure it's less than or equal to 20. You can use the if statement to check if the random value is within the desired range and add the corresponding value to the list.
